results.title: Get wet again
results.brief_description: More fun with Jonathan Coleman. In this program his nervous “brother” Terry learns to swim - with the assistance of Lisa Forrest. The emphasis is on feeling at ease in the water and includes activities such as blowing bubbles, floating, basic swimming and rescue.

results.title: Get wet
results.brief_description: An exciting invitation to do just what the title recommends. The film is about everyone’s capacity to enjoy water sport, be it in a pool or in the open water of lake or river. Includes some dazzling exhibitions of diving and water skiing.

results.title: Get Well Stories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged one to five years old.

results.title: Get well stories
results.brief_description: Introduces Dorothy Butler who passionately believes books should play a crucial role in children’s lives. Attempt to encourage children to read, by capitalising on their fascination with the television screen. Uses professional storytellers and well-known stories, giving fully annotated details for each book used.

results.title: Get us kids out of here (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A study of the context in which young people offend and some of the offences that they commit. The program is introduced by Laurie Taylor, Professor of Sociology at the University of York, and it includes contributions from a wide range of specialists in the subject, as well as the case histories of several young offenders.

results.title: Get rid of rats
results.brief_description: Rats are the destroyers of millions of dollars worth of food each year, as well as carriers of dangerous diseases against which scientists war constantly. The city dump, breeding and feeding ground from which the rats spread through towns and villages, must be replaced with modern garbage disposal techniques. The rat-proofing of cellars and storage buildings must be done with intelligence and common sense to match rat strength and cunning. Only by depriving them of food and shelter can man eliminate these filthy disease-carriers.
